newsitem.title: USA: Loewen says two more states ask for bid data.
newsitem.headline: Loewen says two more states ask for bid data.

text.p: Loewen Group Inc said the attorneys general of North Carolina and New Mexico have requested information regarding the US$2.9 billion takeover bid for the company by Service Corp International.
The requests were made on Monday and represent the latest states that have opened investigation into Service Corp's bid, Loewen said in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

Other states which have previously requested information concerning the bid include Washington, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, California, Texas, Hawaii, Alaska, and New York, Loewen said in the filing.
Houston-based Service Corp is North America's biggest operator of funeral homes and cemetries. Loewen, its closest competitor, is based in Vancouver.
The U.S. Federal Trade Commission and Canada's Competition Bureau are also scrutinizing the proposal, Loewen has said.

On Sunday, Loewen said a U.S. federal court in Texas garanted its motion to dismiss a lawsuit by the bidder, which sought to stop Loewen from bringing antitrust claims against Service Corp. Loewen said it would proceed with its antitrust suit that challenges the proposed deal.
